articles.headline: Far From Presidential Battlegrounds, Blue States Could Decide Congress
articles.snippet: New York and California have become unlikely focal points in the fight for control of the House, as Democrats toil to appeal to wary voters in districts won by President Biden.
articles.abstract: New York and California have become unlikely focal points in the fight for control of the House, as Democrats toil to appeal to wary voters in districts won by President Biden.
articles.lead_paragraph: Campaigning on a rainy recent morning, Mondaire Jones had plenty of reasons to be optimistic about his effort to unseat Representative Mike Lawler, a first-term Republican in the Hudson Valley in New York.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Catie Edmondson

articles.headline: Telegram Founder Charged With Wide Range of Crimes in France
articles.snippet: Pavel Durov, who was arrested near Paris over the weekend as part of a broad investigation into criminal activity on the platform, was also barred from leaving the country.
articles.abstract: Pavel Durov, who was arrested near Paris over the weekend as part of a broad investigation into criminal activity on the platform, was also barred from leaving the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: Pavel Durov, the Russian-born entrepreneur who founded the online communications tool Telegram, was charged on Wednesday in France with a wide range of crimes for failing to prevent illicit activity on the app, and barred from leaving the country.
articles.byline: By Aurelien Breeden and Adam Satariano

articles.headline: At Least 10 Killed as Israeli Military Steps Up West Bank Raids
articles.snippet: Hundreds of troops entered cities in the occupied territory, targeting Palestinian militants. It was a significant escalation after months of raids that have unfolded alongside the war in Gaza.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of troops entered cities in the occupied territory, targeting Palestinian militants. It was a significant escalation after months of raids that have unfolded alongside the war in Gaza.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of Israeli troops backed by drones and armored vehicles carried out raids in the occupied West Bank, Israeli and Palestinian officials said on Wednesday, a growing third front in conflicts that extend from the Egyptian border with the Gaza Strip to southern Lebanon.
articles.byline: By Aaron Boxerman, Adam Rasgon, Raja Abdulrahim and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: Nvidia Revenue Jumps 122% in Positive Sign for Tech’s A.I. Boom
articles.snippet: Expectations for the chipmaker have been through the roof because of its dominance in a key component for artificial intelligence systems.
articles.abstract: Expectations for the chipmaker have been through the roof because of its dominance in a key component for artificial intelligence systems.
articles.lead_paragraph: This summer, Wall Street and Silicon Valley began to question whether generative artificial intelligence could produce enough benefits to justify its staggering costs.

articles.headline: Google’s Antitrust Defeat Opens the Door to Lawsuit From Yelp
articles.snippet: Yelp complained for more than a decade that Google tilted the search market in its favor. After its rival’s landmark legal loss, it finally decided to sue.
articles.abstract: Yelp complained for more than a decade that Google tilted the search market in its favor. After its rival’s landmark legal loss, it finally decided to sue.
articles.lead_paragraph: When a federal judge declared Google an illegal monopoly in a landmark ruling this month, it was not immediately clear what consequences the world’s largest search engine provider would face.

articles.headline: Hong Kong Editors Convicted of Sedition in Blow to Press Freedom
articles.snippet: The editors said they published stories in the public interest. A judge ruled they were guilty of a crime against national security.
articles.abstract: The editors said they published stories in the public interest. A judge ruled they were guilty of a crime against national security.
articles.lead_paragraph: The two veterans of Hong Kong’s long boisterous news media scene didn’t shy away from publishing pro-democracy voices on their Stand News site, even as China cranked up its national security clampdown to silence critics in the city.

articles.headline: Inquiry Into ‘Killer Nurse’ Won’t Weigh Key Question: Is She Innocent?
articles.snippet: More than 20 experts have called on the U.K. government to delay a public inquiry into the case of Lucy Letby, who was convicted of murdering babies, because of growing concerns about the evidence.
articles.abstract: More than 20 experts have called on the U.K. government to delay a public inquiry into the case of Lucy Letby, who was convicted of murdering babies, because of growing concerns about the evidence.
articles.lead_paragraph: A public inquiry into the case of Lucy Letby, a British neonatal nurse convicted of killing seven babies, has come under fire from scientific and medical experts who have called for it to be delayed or broadened to consider whether the deaths could have been caused by other factors.

articles.headline: How a Real Estate Boom Drove Political Corruption in Los Angeles
articles.snippet: Prosecutors say that corruption is rising in California cities as one-party rule, inattentive voters and weakened news media have reduced the traditional checks on power.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors say that corruption is rising in California cities as one-party rule, inattentive voters and weakened news media have reduced the traditional checks on power.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jose Huizar’s downfall at Los Angeles City Hall was as stunning as his rise to success, a political tragedy that, like many in the land of dreams, has become a familiar one.

articles.headline: A Father’s Search for a Son Who Didn’t Want to Be Found
articles.snippet: Bob Garrison was determined to rescue his son from the streets. The path was more difficult than he had imagined.
articles.abstract: Bob Garrison was determined to rescue his son from the streets. The path was more difficult than he had imagined.
articles.lead_paragraph: The trip had been a long shot. Bob Garrison reminded himself of that as he stood on a pier a thousand miles from home. Behind him lay the tile-roofed beach town of San Clemente, Calif., his last stop. Before him stretched the Pacific Ocean, immense and unbound.

articles.headline: At Arlington, Trump Returns to the Politics of the ‘Forever Wars’
articles.snippet: The 2024 presidential race is the first in 24 years without a major American ground war, but Donald J. Trump continues to stoke division over the post-9/11 conflicts that helped give rise to his movement.
articles.abstract: The 2024 presidential race is the first in 24 years without a major American ground war, but Donald J. Trump continues to stoke division over the post-9/11 conflicts that helped give rise to his movement.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow along with the latest election updates as Harris and Trump hit the campaign trail.
